channel.title: Dan Patrick Show (Filtered)
channel.description: Daily DP Show episodes without C&R or Best Of clips.

item.title: Hour 3 – Curt Cignetti Isn’t Going Anywhere, Tony Dungy
item.description:
Dan discusses the potential of Indiana HC Curt Cignetti being a package deal with his quarterback Fernando Mendoza to the Las Vegas Raiders. Former NFL coach and NBC analyst Tony Dungy discusses the sudden firing of John Harbaugh from the Ravens and where Baltimore even goes from here, plus the mess in Tennessee as they try to fill their coaching vacancy.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – Questions About Fernando Mendoza, Dan Orlovsky
item.description:
Dan and the Danettes discuss the seven current openings for coaching in the NFL, as well as the candidates with attractive names. Dan looks at Oregon quarterback Dante Moore and Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza and, while they are good stories, he’s not sure they’re really the top picks for the NFL Draft. Former NFL quarterback and football analyst Dan Orlovsky joins Dan and talks about the NFL job openings and who he thinks is the hottest quarterback going into the NFL playoffs.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – John Harbaugh Fired, Jamison Hensley
item.description:
Dan reacts to the news of John Harbaugh’s dismissal from the Baltimore Ravens and what it means for the Ravens, not to mention other coaches around the NFL who suddenly need to keep an eye on their jobs. Baltimore Ravens reporter Jamison Hensley drops by to talk about the question he asked Lamar Jackson and the relationship between the Ravens locker room and the now-former head coach.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – NFL Black Monday Extended, Jesse Palmer
item.description:
Dan continues to focus on the NFL coaching carousel as there are now eight currently vacant head coaching positions. And former QB and current college football analyst Jesse Palmer drops by to weigh in on the state of college football on the eve of the College Football Playoff Semifinals.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – Ryan Fitzpatrick, Dolphins Fire Mike McDaniel
item.description:
Former NFL QB Ryan Fitzpatrick joins Dan and discusses labels on football players, facing Tom Brady on the field, he and weighs in on the sticky situation in Baltimore that led to John Harbaugh’s dismissal. And the news of Mike McDaniel’s firing by the Dolphins breaks and Dan reacts live.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – Trae Young Is Just a “Buster” Trade, Rooting for Ole Miss
item.description:
Dan thinks the NBA trade that sent Trae Young to Washington is being overhyped. Plus, DP can’t help rooting for Ole Miss just for the wild story line surrounding Lane Kiffin’s exit.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – Most Must-Win, Harassed by the Yankees
item.description:
Dan, the Danettes, and callers make their picks for which team, coach or quarterback needs to win this weekend in the NFL Wildcard games. Dan shares a story of not-so-friendly confines at Yankee Stadium and how he needed Don Mattingly to bail him out from being hassled.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – Oregon/Indiana Preview, Chris Fowler
item.description:
Dan previews tonight’s College Football Playoff Semifinal between Oregon and Indiana.  College football broadcaster Chris Fowler joins Dan and discusses the officiating in the Miami/Ole Miss game, weighs in on automatic bids for the playoffs, and why Indiana’s Curt Cignetti isn’t thinking about moving to the NFL.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – Ole Miss Was Bitter Not Better, Brady Quinn
item.description:
Dan reacts to last night’s College Football Playoff Semifinal between Miami and Ole Miss, wondering what Ole Miss would have looked like if Lane Kiffin was still coaching the team and who exactly the former head coach was rooting for. Host of Fox Sports Radio’s “2 Pros and a Cup of Joe” and former NFL QB Brady Quinn joins Dan to talk about what they’ve seen from the College Football Playoff, the SEC getting shut out from yet another national title, and why ESPN still can’t help but talk about Notre Dame.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 - Blurring the Lines in Sports Journalism
item.description:
Dan continues to dive into the best and worst of Wild Card Weekend in the NFL. Dan reacts to an interaction between Jaguars HC Liam Coen and a reporter in the postgame press conference and examines what this means within the state of sports journalism.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 - Should the Packers Fire Matt LaFleur?
item.description:
Dan continues his NFL playoff reactions and ponders if the Packers should look to replace Matt LaFleur after another playoff collapse. CBS NFL analyst Ross Tucker was stunned by the Eagles' home playoff loss to a depleted 49ers team, and sees Mike Tomlin staying in Pittsburgh as long as he wants. Plus, the guys give their best and worst of the weekend.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 - An All-Time NFL Playoff Weekend
item.description:
Dan Patrick reacts to an eventful opening to the NFL playoffs, highlighting the 49ers impressive win over the Eagles, comeback wins from the Bears and Rams, and much more. Plus, would John Harbaugh actually be an improvement over Matt LaFleur in Green Bay? 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 - Reggie Miller
item.description:
Dan looks at Aaron Rodgers' legacy and debates if Rodgers can truly go out with this sort of performance. Basketball Hall of Famer Reggie Miller praises James Harden for moving to 9th on the all-time NBA scoring list,and sees Spurs-Thunder trending towards a real rivalry. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 - Bill Cowher
item.description:
Dan talks with Hall of Fame Steelers HC Bill Cowher after the Steelers' season ended Monday night. Cowher says Pittsburgh lacks a clear long-term plan and believes Mike Tomlin has earned the right to stay after 19 seasons with the franchise. Plus, some major news in the battle between the PGA Tour and LIV Golf.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 - What's Next for Aaron Rodgers and Mike Tomlin
item.description:
Dan Patrick reacts to the Texans eliminating the Steelers on Monday night to close out the Wild Card Round. Dan discusses the potential retirement of Aaron Rodgers and a potential separation in Pittsburgh for Mike Tomlin. Dan looks at the Texans' chances to get past the Patriots in the Divisional Round. Plus, James Harden reached a milestone on Monday night.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 - Big Ticket
item.description:
Dan and The Danette's talk about what the Ravens might do at their head coaching spot, more thoughts on Mike Tomlin's future, Rich Paul's comments on his podcast and how it reflects on LeBron James, ticket prices for the National Championship game, and more!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 - Long Road Ahead
item.description:
Dan & the Danette's talk about how quick or slow the rebuild process in Pittsburgh is going to be, former NFL QB & ESPN analyst Alex Smith joins the show, and more! 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 - Tomlin On Your Television
item.description:
Dan Patrick talks what's next for Mike Tomlin after he stepped down from the Steelers head coaching position, Gerry Dulac of the Pittsburgh Post Gazette joins the show to talk about Tomlin's departure from the team, and more!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – Boomer Esiason, Robert Griffin III
item.description:
Dan and the Danettes don’t want to hear anything more about the ’85 Bears. Former NFL quarterback and New York sports radio host Boomer Esiason joins Dan to talk about the impending hire of John Harbaugh and what it means for the Giants. Former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III stops by and discusses the future for Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers, what this playoff means for the legacy of Bills quarterback Josh Allen, and how he sees the divisional round of the NFL playoffs playing out.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – Rich Paul Doesn’t Run the Lakers, Louis Riddick
item.description:
Rich Paul responds to controversy over his comments about trading Austin Reeves, and Dan must remind him once again that he doesn’t run the Lakers. ESPN football commentator and former front office executive Louis Riddick joins Dan to discuss the Giants closing in on John Harbaugh as their new head coach, plus more topics from NFL coaching carousel.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – John Harbaugh Is Coming to New York, Dante Moore Staying in School
item.description:
It’s not official just yet, but all signs are pointing to former Ravens coach John Harbaugh landing on his feet with the New York Giants, and DP weighs in on what he’s hearing from his sources. Oregon quarterback Dante Moore is heading back to college while former Nebraska quarterback Dylan Raiola is transferring to Oregon too.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 –Brooks Koepka Ditches LIV Golf, Chris Simms
item.description:
Dan and the Danettes discuss Brooks Koepka and his return to the PGA after ditching them for LIV Golf. Chris Simms discusses who has the most pressure in the NFL Divisional Round, defends Dante Moore’s decision to return to college, and explains how Sam Darnold suffered an oblique injury during practice and what it could mean for the 49ers/Seahawks tilt.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – Dodgers Aren’t Ruining Baseball, Chris “Mad Dog” Russo
item.description:
Dan questions the narrative that the Dodgers are ruining baseball. And Chris “Mad Dog” Russo joins Dan and reacts to the Dodgers getting Kyle Tucker and what needs to happen to bring competitiveness back to baseball, plus he weighs in on impending hire of John Harbaugh by the New York Giants.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – Dodgers Land Kyle Tucker, Matt Norlander
item.description:
Dan reacts to the Los Angeles Dodgers landing Kyle Tucker as the rich get richer and complaints arise again as the power of baseball tilts even farther. CBS Sports senior writer Matt Norlander joins Dan to talk about the massive scandal rocking college basketball where 29 individuals are indicted for fixing games, and when the gambling scandals start to become routine in sports.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – Most Improved NFL Team, Albert Breer
item.description:
Dan and the Danettes consider the NFL teams who had the biggest turn-around this season, led by the New England Patriots and the Carolina Panthers. And NFL insider Albert Breer drops by to weigh in on the Bills firing HC Sean McDermott.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – NFL Playoff Reaction, Steve Tasker
item.description:
Dan breaks down what happened in the NFL over the weekend including a very controversial interception. And former Bills WR and current analyst, Steve Tasker tells DP he was very surprised by Sean McDermott’s firing.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – CFP Title Game Preview, Sean McDermott Fired
item.description:
Dan weighs in on tonight’s College Football Playoff title game between Indiana and Miami, and he considers the future of college football. And he reacts to the Buffalo Bills firing HC Sean McDermott after the Bills were eliminated from the NFL Playoffs last night.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – Ross Tucker, Stidham-Time
item.description:
Former NFL OL Ross Tucker stops by to weigh in on Indiana’s National Championship last night and the upcoming NFL Conference Championship games. Plus, Dan and the Danettes consider the implications of Bo Nix’s injury for Sean Payton, Jarrett Stidham and the rest of the Broncos.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – Chase Daniel, Curt Cignetti Is a Bargain
item.description:
Former NFL QB Chase Daniel drops by to talk about Fernando Mendoza’s potential in the NFL after winning the Heisman Trophy and a National Championship. And DP breaks down what Curt Cignetti is making compared to the highest paid coaches in college football.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – Indiana Makes History, NFL Coaching Carousel
item.description:
Dan never thought he’d ever be reporting on a National Championship for Indiana Hoosiers Football and he’s happy for Lee Corso, Curt Cignetti, Fernando Mendoza and the entire Hoosier Nation. And he details the latest developments in the NFL coaching carousel.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – Giants Already Got Their First Win, Reggie Miller
item.description:
Dan talks about the Bills decision to fire Sean McDermott and thinks the New York Giants won just by introducing John Harbaugh as their new head coach. And Hall of Famer Reggie Miller drops by to talk about disappointing playoff performances and how long Steph Curry will continue to play in the NBA.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – Disappointing Playoff Calls, Jason Garrett
item.description:
DP and the Danettes take calls about the worst calls in NFL playoff games. And former Dallas Cowboys HC Jason Garrett drops by and answers questions about his interview for the open Tennessee Titans job.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – Bills Mafia Still Mad, Cheaters in Cooperstown
item.description:
Dan thinks Buffalo Bills fans are making too much of the controversial interception that effectively eliminated them from the playoffs and they need to move on. Plus, DP wonders if Carlos Beltran’s involvement in the Astros cheating scandal should have disqualified him from Hall of Fame consideration.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – Conspiracy Theory Gaining Traction in San Francisco, Sam Fortier, Remembering Kobe’s 81-pt Game
item.description:
The San Francisco 49ers investigate a potentially electric reason why they’ve been getting injured. The Washington Post’s Sam Fortier explains the pseudo-science behind this and what his investigation has turned up on all of this. Dan, the Danettes and callers reminisce about Kobe Bryant’s legendary 81-point game, including words from those he played against in that game – Jalen Rose and Chris Bosh – plus words from Dan’s own interview with Kobe about that night.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – NFL Award Nominees, Booger McFarland
item.description:
The nominees for NFL awards are out, and Dan discusses his own personal picks for Comeback Player of the Year, Coach of the Year and more. Former NFL DT Booger McFarland discusses where Buffalo goes from here, the pressure riding on the Broncos, and why southern schools have begun to lag in college football.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – Bills Owner Gets Loose, Jay Skurski
item.description:
Bills owner Terry Pegula got loose in a press conference yesterday where he confirmed his decision to fire Sean McDermott was based heavily on their playoff loss to the Broncos and Dan is concerned his reactionary decisions might turn off some prospective head coaching candidates. And Jay Skurski from the Buffalo News joins Dan to discuss why Pegula decided to have a press conference after all these years and where the team goes from here.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 - Chappelle, Bizkit & a Brother
item.description:
Covino & Rich have fun with their Old-School topic of the week! The crew & callers weigh-in on the best comedy sketches of all time, in honor of Chappelle Show anniversary! Plus, 'C&R SHOW-and-TELL' features a bizkit & a brother!

Follow C&R on their Apple Podcast page: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/covino-rich/id1212071900

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 3 – Raiders on the Clock, Most Must Win & Best Week in Sports
item.description:
The Las Vegas Raiders are on the clock with the first pick of the NFL Draft and DP talks more about their options. Fritzy answers “Most Must Win Game” and “Best Week in Sports” in the same way – totally fixated on the Broncos.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 2 – The Raiders Have Options, Championship Snow-Over, Devin McCourty
item.description:
Dan debates with callers over his belief that the Raiders should shop around the first overall pick and that taking Fernando Mendoza would be premature. The Danettes discuss staying over Sunday for the football games and possibly getting snowed in. Super Bowl champion Devin McCourty shares his memories from playing in the big game, how he would plan to play against Jared Stidham and the uncoverable power of Puka Nacua.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Hour 1 – Bulletin Board Material, Steelers Rebuild
item.description:
Dan and the Danettes discuss Broncos’ HC Sean Payton’s recent comments and wonder if the Patriots will use them for motivation. And Dan breaks down former Steelers’ QB Ben Roethlisberger’s suggestion that they avoid drafting a quarterback in the first round of the NFL Draft.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
